segments.content: **Cyril and Matthieu from [Theodo Apps (formerly BAM)](https://apps.theodo.com/en?utm_source=thisweekinreact)** here ğŸ‘‹, filling in to bring you the latest news from the React and React Native worlds.
segments.sourceMdx: **Cyril and Matthieu from [Theodo Apps (formerly BAM)](https://apps.theodo.com/en?utm_source=thisweekinreact)** here ğŸ‘‹, filling in to bring you the latest news from the React and React Native worlds.

segments.content: Itâ€™s a relatively calm week for React, with some ongoing discussions about the Suspense drama in React 19.
segments.sourceMdx: Itâ€™s a relatively calm week for React, with some ongoing discussions about the Suspense drama in React 19.

segments.content:
**But React Native? Thatâ€™s where the real action is!**\
From Expo demoing a way to integrate React DOM components to the exciting launch of React Native WebGPU, thereâ€™s plenty to talk about. Plus, weâ€™re diving into new approaches to native module development that are sure to shake things up. And React Native 0.75 is around the corner, we'll cover it next week!

* ğŸ‘€ [React 19 - Disabling prerendering siblings of suspended components breaking common pattern](https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/29898): The React team is working on reversing this change that was planned to be included in React 19 but would have degraded the performance of lots of SPAs. No ETA yet, it may take some time to get a stable React 19 release
* ğŸ¦ [Matt Pocock has a suggestion for a new approach to library typings](https://x.com/mattpocockuk/status/1821124980043636841): React could for instance expose `useState` types with TypeScript namespaces

segments.content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native
segments.sourceMdx: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

segments.content: [![React Native WebGPU](/emails/issues/196/rn-webgpu.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-DGY98cTjk)
segments.sourceMdx: [![React Native WebGPU](/emails/issues/196/rn-webgpu.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-DGY98cTjk)

segments.content: **ğŸ¥ [React Native WebGPU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-DGY98cTjk)**
segments.sourceMdx: **ğŸ¥ [React Native WebGPU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-DGY98cTjk)**

segments.content:
React Native WebGPU has just launched, offering a unified API to leverage the GPU for advanced graphics and computation in React Native! By reusing the Web API standard, we will be able to easily integrate existing WebGPU code samples and libraries, such as ThreeJS, directly into React Native.
Beyond just graphics, React Native WebGPU can be used for tasks like matrix computations, making it interesting for on-device machine learning algorithms. It's built using Nitro Modules for smooth Typescript to C++ interoperability. Currently, it's available in technical preview, signaling exciting developments ahead!
segments.sourceMdx:
React Native WebGPU has just launched, offering a unified API to leverage the GPU for advanced graphics and computation in React Native! By reusing the Web API standard, we will be able to easily integrate existing WebGPU code samples and libraries, such as ThreeJS, directly into React Native.
Beyond just graphics, React Native WebGPU can be used for tasks like matrix computations, making it interesting for on-device machine learning algorithms. It's built using Nitro Modules for smooth Typescript to C++ interoperability. Currently, it's available in technical preview, signaling exciting developments ahead!

segments.content: **The Future of React Native Modules**
segments.sourceMdx: **The Future of React Native Modules**

segments.content: Exciting times for React Native developers! Marc Rousavy is shaking things up with NitroModules, a new way to write native code ğŸ“¦ [thatâ€™s blowing away existing solutions in speed tests](https://github.com/mrousavy/NitroBenchmarks). He's encountered some limitations with JSI in VisionCamera. The project is already stable on the C++ side and is already being used in various projects like ğŸ¦ [react-native-unistyles](https://x.com/jpudysz/status/1822541758137303233) and react-native-webgpu, with Swift and Kotlin bindings still in progress.
segments.sourceMdx: Exciting times for React Native developers! Marc Rousavy is shaking things up with NitroModules, a new way to write native code ğŸ“¦ [thatâ€™s blowing away existing solutions in speed tests](https://github.com/mrousavy/NitroBenchmarks). He's encountered some limitations with JSI in VisionCamera. The project is already stable on the C++ side and is already being used in various projects like ğŸ¦ [react-native-unistyles](https://x.com/jpudysz/status/1822541758137303233) and react-native-webgpu, with Swift and Kotlin bindings still in progress.

segments.content: ğŸ‘€ [Meanwhile, a new proposal to push the use of Swift for TurboModules has landed.](https://github.com/okwasniewski/discussions-and-proposals/blob/22edd2c7853aaf2ee654b57f4521e43d668103fb/proposals/0000-swift-turbo-modules.md) These changes will ease native modules development by moving away from Objective-C and C++. With these updates, building native modules is about to get a whole lot better!

With these updates, building native modules is about to get a whole lot better!
